About Me

Hi, I'm Anant Dashpute.

My work consists in helping companies and researchers to analyse their datasets. I am skilled for most data-science steps: data pre-processing, application of statistical methods,Selecting best algorithm, testing and training methods , Validation, Optimizing code and more.

After completing research worked in NLP Research LAB, at Indian Institute of space science and technology

Now I'm now working for Continental Automotive as a Research engineer.

Data Management

A data project always start with a data enginering step. You need to learn, preprocess and harvest data and store it in an adequate format to be able to use it.

I can help you to..
  • Harvest data from different sources like APIs, SQL databases or messy Excel spreadsheets.
  • Preprocess and reshape data to make further analyses easier.
  • Clean datasets removing outliers and abberant data.
  • Reports the creation of data analysis reports using PowerBI
Contact me
Tell me more about your project at # to see if we can work together.
Github Linkedin Mail



Data Mining

Crunch the data to get answer to your question. Give insight to the information.

I can help you for
  • Exploratory analysis of a dataset.
  • Creation of clean and reproducible reports using R Markdown.
  • Application of statistical methods on your dataset.
  • Creation of custom scripts for analysing your data automatically

Example:
  • I'm the author of several scientific publications where I was in charge to explore and understand complex dataset in order to answer scientific questions.
  • I recovered information about crypto currency prices on different exchanges and explored the data looking for arbitrage opportunities.

Contact me
Tell me more about your project at # to see if we can work together.

Exploring co-author relationships

Online app

Description

Google Scholar is a service that provides any researchers list of publication. I made a script that harvest this information on the web using R. It then take the list of all co-authors and check for each pair if they have published a paper together.

The network information is then visualized using static graphs with R, and also using interactive version thanks to d3.js
Read more
Data mining part of the pipeline is available on github. Visualizations are used as example in my other projects: static charts in data to viz, interactive ones in the d3 graph gallery.
